usefulItems: serving plates, thermal serving bowl or other large bowl
title: Pork fillet with mustard

ingredients.content: 60 g brown onion, cut into halves
1 pinch ground black pepper, to taste
450 g pork fillet, cut into thin slices (1 cm)
100 g fresh mushrooms, cut into slices
1 - 2 sprigs flat-leaf parsley, leaves only, chopped for garnishing

preparations.content: Place dry vermouth or Madeira, cream, onion, garlic, seeded mustard, hot English mustard, Chicken stock paste, salt and pepper into mixing bowl. Layer sliced pork fillet and mushrooms in alternating layers into the simmering basket, then insert simmering basket into mixing bowl. Cook <b>10 min/100°C/speed 1<b>.

Stir pork and mushrooms in simmering basket with aid of spatula to ensure even cooking, then cook <b>10-13 min/100°C/speed 1<b>, until pork is cooked. Remove simmering basket with aid of spatula. Transfer pork and mushrooms into a thermal serving bowl or other large bowl and set aside to keep warm.
Add crème fraîche and cornflour and cook <b>3 min/80°C/speed 4<b>.
Place pork and mushrooms onto serving plates, pour mustard sauce over the top and garnish with parsley and serve immediately.

hintsAndTricks: Serve with steamed vegetables or a side salad.
Please refer to The Basic Cookbook or Everyday Cookbook for the Chicken stock paste recipe.
This recipe can be increased to feed a larger family by cooking the pork and mushrooms in the Varoma. Cooking time will need to be adjusted accordingly.
